what: Evaluation of Individual-Level Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints
title: Evaluation of Individual-Level Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints
text: implementation Kendall’s rank correlation coefficient survival ordinal endpoints: Oakes D. model association bivariate survival data. Journal Royal Statistical Society: Series B (Methodological) 1982; 44(3): 414–422. doi:10.1111/j.2517-6161.1982.tb01222.x. Lakhal L, Rivest L-P, Beaudoin D. IPCW estimator Kendall’s tau bivariate censoring. International Journal Biostatistics 2009; 5(1): Article 8. doi:10.2202/1557-4679.1121. Okui J, Nagashima K, Matsuda S, et al. Surrogacy pathological complete response overall survival: individual patient data analysis ten RCTs neoadjuvant treatment plus surgery esophageal cancer. preparation (2024+). URL: https://nshi-stat.github.io/surrosurvo/

title: Evaluation of Individual-Level Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints
code: # The development version from GitHub: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("nshi-stat/surrosurvo")  # From CRAN (will be released): # install.packages("surrosurvo")

what: Random number generation for Correlated Survival and Ordinal Outcomes — generate_rv
title: Random number generation for Correlated Survival and Ordinal Outcomes — generate_rv
text: function generates random number vectors correlated survival ordinal outcomes. Gaussian Clayton copula used specify correlation structure. Marginal distributions based exponential distribution. order outcome generated discretizing one correlated random numbers based quantile.

title: Random number generation for Correlated Survival and Ordinal Outcomes — generate_rv
code: generate_rv(   target_tau,   num_samples,   censoring_rate,   copula_type = c("Gaussian", "Clayton"),   x_levels = 5,   hr = 1 )

title: Random number generation for Correlated Survival and Ordinal Outcomes — generate_rv
text: target_tau target value Kendall's \(\tau\) num_samples number simulation samples censoring_rate censoring rate copula_type copula type (default = "Gaussian") Gaussian: Gaussian copula Clayton: Clayton copula x_levels number category ordinal outcome (default = 5) hr hazard ratio survival time (default = 1.0)

title: Random number generation for Correlated Survival and Ordinal Outcomes — generate_rv
text: y: survival time censoring time outcome vector event: event indicator outcome vector x: ordinal (continuous) outcome vector t: true survival time vector (simulation) c: true censoring time vector (simulation) x0: x discretization (simulation)

title: Random number generation for Correlated Survival and Ordinal Outcomes — generate_rv

what: Evaluation of Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints — surrosurvo-package
title: Evaluation of Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints — surrosurvo-package
Evaluation of Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints — surrosurvo-package

what: Evaluation of Individual-Level Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints — surrosurvo
title: Evaluation of Individual-Level Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints — surrosurvo
text: function can estimate Kendall's \(\tau\) follows: Oakes (1982)'s non-parametric estimator \(\hat{\tau}_o\), Lakhal et al. (2009)'s inverse probability weighting (IPCW) estimators \(\hat{\tau}_{mo1}\) \(\hat{\tau}_{mo2}\), Okui et al. (2024)'s modified IPCW estimators \(\hat{\tau}_{so1}\) \(\hat{\tau}_{so2}\). \(\hat{\tau}_{so1}\) \(\hat{\tau}_{so2}\) can take account tie data. Confidence intervals based jackknife standard errors normal approximation.

title: Evaluation of Individual-Level Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints — surrosurvo
code: surrosurvo(y, event, x, level = 0.95, confint = TRUE, parallel = FALSE)

title: Evaluation of Individual-Level Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints — surrosurvo
text: y survival time censoring time outcome vector event event indicator outcome vector x ordinal (continuous) outcome vector level confidence level confidence interval (default = 0.95) confint whether calculation confidence intervals performed (default = TRUE) parallel number threads used parallel computing, FALSE means single threading (default = FALSE)

title: Evaluation of Individual-Level Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints — surrosurvo
text: method: names estimators \(\hat{\tau}\) tau: estimates \(\hat{\tau}\) se: standard errors \(\hat{\tau}\) lcl: lower confidence limits \(\hat{\tau}_l\) ucl: uper confidence limits \(\hat{\tau}_u\)

title: Evaluation of Individual-Level Surrogacy for Survival and Ordinal Endpoints — surrosurvo
